item.title: Kayla add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Here it is,' Nigel said. Mrs D, Mrs I, Mrs FFI, Mrs C, Mrs U, Mrs LTY. That spells difficulty.' How perfectly ridiculous!' snorted Miss Trunchbull. 'Why are all these women married?" -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "I cannot for the life of me understand why small children take so long to grow up. I think they do it deliberately, just to annoy me." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "A BOOK?! WHAT D'YOU WANNA FLAMING BOOK FOR?...WE'VE GOT A LOVELY TELLY WITH A 12-INCH SCREEN AND NOW YA WANNA BOOK!" -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "I'm right and you're wrong, I'm big and you're small, and there's nothing you can do about it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Alan Paton
item.description: "Cry, the beloved country, for the unborn child that's the inheritor of our fear. Let him not love the earth too deeply. Let him not laugh too gladly when the water runs through his fingers, nor stand too silent when the setting sun makes red the veld with fire. Let him not be too moved when the birds of his land are singing. Nor give too much of his heart to a mountain or a valley. For fear will rob him if he gives too much." -- Alan Paton

item.title: Kayla add a quote by Alan Paton
item.description: "There is not much talking now. A silence falls upon them all. This is no time to talk of hedges and fields, or the beauties of any country. Sadness and fear and hate, how they well up in the heart and mind, whenever one opens pages of these messengers of doom. Cry for the broken tribe, for the law and the custom that is gone. Aye, and cry aloud for the man who is dead, for the woman and children bereaved. Cry, the beloved country, these things are not yet at an end. The sun pours down on the earth, on the lovely land that man cannot enjoy. He knows only the fear of his heart." -- Alan Paton
